def.ru: маленькая струя, в т.ч. пота, воды с крыши и т.д.
def.en: small stream, including sweat, water from leaking roof etc.

notes: Several instances of dew on multiple days
The word qaˁbqaˁ is never used outside of this expression
Rarely used, for different types of firewood
The abs. and loc. have a stress difference: bíqla vs. biqlá.
Different inflection from sg.: gen. pl. mirq-a-lla vs. sg. mirqi-la, etc.
A habitual participle from a verbal stem
Sg. form should be ʡaˁžum, but it is only used in the sense ‘kurdyuk’. At the same time, the pl. of kurdyuk (ʡaˁžumti) is different from ‘buttocks’.
Formally pl. but triggers sg. agreement (bebtni bitaˁqibcab)
Pus that flows quickly, e.g. from a wound
“Long-term” pus (that flows from the eye etc.)
Of a man or body part
Historically from kːurcːi ‘kurze, dumpling’ (the word does not exist anymore)
Also cf. intr. katː-erz-araj / karuzaraj ‘to get cleared, strained)
From qar ‘above’ + nejg ‘milk’. The sg. refers to a small amount of sour cream
The word zamana is used here in a modified form
